main event: A circular, white light object the size of a half dollar was observed moving slowly, climbing straight up, and then disappearing in Holliston, Massachusetts on 10/30/1952 at 11:00 p.m.
interesting points: The object had a silver, metallic appearance and made no sound.
The witness reported the object hovered motionlessly for several minutes before accelerating rapidly and disappearing in the distance.
The witness was unable to estimate the speed or distance of the object.
The witness described the object as resembling a large, flat disc.
The witness drew a diagram showing the object's path, with an 'A' at the beginning and 'B' at the end to indicate the motion.
sighted object: a circular, white light object the size of a half dollar
